components.description: A circle shown in the color of black. May be used to represent anything black.
components.title: Medium Black Circle

description: A circle shown in the color of black. May be used to represent anything black.
title: Medium Black Circle

version.description: The following characters we added to Unicode in 2005 and given emoji presentation status in the years 2010-2015.

emoji_net_data.definition: Black Circle was approved as part of Unicode 4.1 in 2005 under the name “Medium Black Circle” and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015. Copy and paste http://emojipedia.org/medium-black-circle/
emoji_net_data.name: black circle

bn:00103545a: Of or relating to or determined by geometry
Of, or relating to geometry; geometric.

bn:00099702a: In the shape of, or moving in a circle.
Circular or cylindrical; having a circular cross-section in one direction.
Having a circular, cylindrical or spherical shape.

bn:00098480a: Being of the achromatic color of maximum darkness; having little or no hue owing to absorption of almost all incident light
Absorbing all light and reflecting none; dark and hueless.
Dark and colourless; not reflecting visible light.

bn:00103764a: Having a colour between black and white, like ash or stone.
Of an achromatic color of any lightness intermediate between the extremes of white and black
Having a color somewhere between white and black, as the ash of an ember.

bn:00014305n: A round fastener sewn to shirts and coats etc to fit through buttonholes
In modern clothing and fashion design, a button is a small fastener, most commonly made of plastic, but also frequently of seashell, which secures two pieces of fabric together.
Knob or small disc serving as a fastener.
A fastener consisting of a knob or disc that is passed through a slit in the adjacent material.
A knob or disc that is passed through a loop or (buttonhole), serving as a fastener.

bn:00019169n: A two-dimensional geometric figure, a disk, consisting of the set of all those points of a plane at a distance less than or equal to a fixed distance from another point.
Ellipse in which the two axes are of equal length; a plane curve generated by one point moving at a constant distance from a fixed point
A circle is a simple shape of Euclidean geometry that is the set of all points in a plane that are at a given distance from a given point, the center.
Circles are simple shapes of Euclidean geometry consisting of those points in a plane which are equidistant from a given point, the center.
A two-dimensional, geometric shape that is made up of every point on a plane which is equidistant from the centre. May be drawn with a pair of compasses.
